Articles.Content:
Hi everyone. 

This question has been asked like 4 years ago, but that was still in early Alpha. I wanted to ask whether (Steam) KSP sends crash reports automatically, or if they have to be send manually. 

For a few days now (on unmodded career), Kerbal starts crashing, usually during maneuvers (or take-off). Once a crash happened, KSP will run for maybe 30mins to 1 hour before crashing again, only a restart stops chain of crashes. This has now happened repeatedly sadly. 

Soooo. what next?

Edited August 17, 2016 by Jambalaya

Welcome to the forums!

Moving to Kerbal Network, since this is a discussion about the infrastructure around playing the game, rather than about the game itself.

In general, if you have a problem with the game, and you're running un-modded, then a good place to post is in the relevant tech support forum:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/forum/69-technical-support-pc-unmodded-installs/

If you have a consistently reproducible problem, and you're pretty sure it's a bug in the game that needs fixing, and you have enough information that someone who wanted to fix it would have a reasonable way of reproducing the problem, then you can take it to the next level and file a bug report.

(Or you can do both, in which case it may be helpful to include a link to the forum post in your bug report, and vice versa.  The former does a better job of leveraging the KSP community, the latter does a better job of leveraging Squad.)

As for the actual crash reports:  as far as I know, nothing happens with them automatically.  They may or may not be useful, depending on how reproducible the problem is and what information's in the report.  Case-by-case.
